title.narrative: OP3: Water, Sanitation, and Hygiene (WASH) IN EMERGENCY & CLIMATE CHANGE

description.narrative: By 2021, Government partners have strengthened capacity to better prepare and respond to humanitarian situation and build resilience to climate change in an innovative and coordinated way, which contributes to Disaster Risk Reduction, Sanitation, Sanitation (Covid), Wash And Emergencies, Wash â€“ General, Water. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2021, the most disadvantaged children and their families have equitable access to and use of sustainable improved water sources, sanitation facilities, and adopt hygiene practices

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2021, Government partners have strengthened capacity to better prepare and respond to humanitarian situation and buildresilience to climate change in an innovative and coordinated way

description.narrative: UNICEF provided strong technical support to the Government throughout the COVID-19 preparedness and response, provided leadership to the UN WASH sector, and facilitated collaboration and cooperation across WASH development partners throughout the COVID-19 preparedness and response. UNICEF also ensured that emergency WASH supplies were in place to support up to 25,000 people as needed. Emergency stocks were maintained, to ensure that up to 25,000 people could be supported with emergency WASH supplies | Status:On-track | As-of Date:01/02/2022
